commit 74013b9b156161a159015aa1aaccda33a89858dc
Merge: 77fa931 23a889d
Author: Yann Collet <Cyan4973@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Fri Nov 18 12:33:42 2016 -0800

    Merge pull request #94 from Ashalah/patch-1
    
    Fix minor compile error using XXH_ACCEPT_NULL_INPUT_POINTER

commit 23a889d6377ff9e24e5a344d44c4b25aa3c18a98
Author: Andy Robbins <raicuandi@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Nov 19 00:00:23 2016 +1100

    Fix minor compile error using XXH_ACCEPT_NULL_INPUT_POINTER
    
    XXH64_endian_align() has a compile issue using XXH_ACCEPT_NULL_INPUT_POINTER, because it declares
    
    ` const BYTE* const bEnd = p + len;`
    
    and then tries to assign to it again with the line `bEnd=p=(const BYTE*)(size_t)32;`
    
    XXH32_endian_align() avoids this issue by declaring `const BYTE* bEnd = p + len;` (notice the pointer itself is non-const here)
    
    I have not looked much into this, just made the most obvious change to get it to work.

commit 77fa9318a69c22388313a92eaeca0833fc41021e
Author: Yann Collet <cyan@fb.com>
Date:   Thu Nov 17 10:50:04 2016 -0800

    minor coding style change

commit b0cdfdc884ab4ab00a4b9f1e407d2ac726eaf0de
Merge: ca39610 43fa796
Author: Yann Collet <Cyan4973@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 15 11:12:14 2016 -0800

    Merge pull request #90 from ChrisKitching/betterCMake
    
    Build the xxhsum binary with cmake as well

commit 43fa796c210f311bfedb061ee6c627ae227acec3
Author: Chris Kitching <chriskitching@linux.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 15 10:25:34 2016 +0000

    Build xxhsum binary as well

commit 5ab73ee82245b586f69762411edc7824d778ee2a
Author: Chris Kitching <chriskitching@linux.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 15 10:15:48 2016 +0000

    Rely on BUILD_SHARED_LIBS instead of custom options
    
    Instead of having your own option for choosing between static
    and shared versions of the library, use cmake's built-in option
    for this:
    https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/variable/BUILD_SHARED_LIBS.html
    
    Set -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON to get a shared library, and omit it
    or set it to OFF to get a static one.
    Can add one extra line to the cmake file to make the default be
    shared. Makes most of the cmake crap go away.

commit f89d036ed053cc1f3c5c274b3ce9d93706668d5e
Author: Chris Kitching <chriskitching@linux.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 15 10:07:41 2016 +0000

    Declare options using option()
    
    This has the very slight advantage of allowing cmake to provide
    nice documentation of available options (such as in the cmake gui,
    if used)

commit 411dbc48b97932fcd6db8b1446f8afb130c525af
Merge: 91ce5bf 6f0ca50
Author: Yann Collet <yann.collet.73@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Aug 18 13:51:55 2016 +0200

    Merge pull request #83 from Leandros/dev
    
    Replace GCC_VERSION with XXH_GCC_VERSION

commit 6f0ca50e01b6e3f7c942078ab4418556937a5823
Author: Arvid Gerstmann <dev@arvid-g.de>
Date:   Thu Aug 18 11:54:50 2016 +0200

    Replace GCC_VERSION with XXH_GCC_VERSION
    
    GCC_VERSION is quite a common macro name, and might clash with already
    defined macros. It's safer to use a XXH_ prefix.

commit 10fcb151c424df9e05c8fdeb0b26f1ecbbb2054f
Merge: 3c7502c 7ad2406
Author: Yann Collet <yann.collet.73@gmail.com>

    [v2] changes to increase xxhash' configurability when inlining it

commit 7ad240669e11646a0926ce55ade753d59f21b837
Author: Emilio G. Cota <cota@braap.org>
Date:   Thu Mar 24 18:02:39 2016 -0400

    xxhash: rename XXH_USELESS_ALIGN_BRANCH to XXH_FORCE_ALIGN_CHECK
    
    The name change also includes inverting the logic, which makes the evaluation
    logic clearer: if FORCE_ALIGN_CHECK is set, we perform the check;
    if not, we don't.
    
    While at it, allow calling code to set the flag. The use case for this
    is the following: calling code might have a guarantee that the input data
    is aligned. Thus, for maximum performance, it would set:
    
      XXH_FORCE_ALIGN_CHECK to 0, to skip the alignment check
      XXH_FORCE_MEMORY_ACCESS 2, to copy data in chunks of 32 or 64 bits
    
    Without this change, there is no way to skip the alignment check on
    certain architectures.
    
    Signed-off-by: Emilio G. Cota <cota@braap.org>

commit efc5403144dce34e5440564889e7bb8145f0ed83
Author: Emilio G. Cota <cota@braap.org>
Date:   Thu Mar 24 17:39:34 2016 -0400

    xxhash: allow external definition of XXH_FORCE_NATIVE_FORMAT
    
    This is particularly useful when inlining the library.
    
    Signed-off-by: Emilio G. Cota <cota@braap.org>

commit e579f8e0131f687d3c50a079cbfd725038630b55
Author: Emilio G. Cota <cota@braap.org>
Date:   Thu Mar 24 17:49:14 2016 -0400

    gitignore: ignore xxhsum and xxh(32|64)sum
    
    Signed-off-by: Emilio G. Cota <cota@braap.org>

commit 96abe78db944ee31c3e95546ebf83d0ca8a65401
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>

commit ddbed4c2a9311f5299263882637a5d3be1321954
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Feb 20 03:08:46 2016 +0900

    Add manpage files: xxhsum.1 and xxhsum.1.md
    
    You can generate xxhsum.1 by the following procedure:
    
    ```
    sudo apt-get install -y ruby-ronn
    # make man generates xxhsum.1 from xxhsum.1.md #
    make man
    
    # edit xxhsum.1.md here #
    # auto preview for development
    make preview-man
    ```
    
    `Makefile` has the following tricky part:
    
    ```
    xxhsum.1: xxhsum.1.md
            cat $^ | $(MD2ROFF) $(MD2ROFF_FLAGS) | sed -n '/^\.\\\".*/!p' > $@
    ```
    
    Last `sed` command removes `ronn`'s comment lines (`ronn`'s version, author, URL).
    It doesn't mean disrespect for `ronn`.  We need this removal because we must
    ignore `ronn`'s version to minimize diff.

commit 8485beac0693c496a25d67c79cbf4b47c6545d17
Author: Yann Collet <yann.collet.73@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 19 16:28:29 2016 +0100

    update lib version

commit 2d074826ee928f361032b19540849fcc7e1c6f93
Merge: 84e6218 80c3562
Author: Yann Collet <yann.collet.73@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 19 16:23:40 2016 +0100

    Merge pull request #53 from t-mat/wip/check-files
    
    Add command line switch "-c"/"--check"

commit 80c3562c60fbcd9e9e905f9c228703f4befe6aa4
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 19 23:33:22 2016 +0900

    Reorder operation to avoid warning for unary minus operator for unsigned type
    
    For example, VC++ shows the following warnings:
    
    1>  xxhsum.c
    1>..\..\xxhsum.c(620): warning C4146: unary minus operator applied to unsigned type, result still unsigned
    1>..\..\xxhsum.c(621): warning C4146: unary minus operator applied to unsigned type, result still unsigned
    
    The folliwing thread is good pointer for unary minus operators behaviour:
    
    C: unary minus operator behavior with unsigned operands
    http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8026694/
    
    > 6.2.5c9 says: A computation involving unsigned operands can never overflow,
    > because a result that cannot be represented by the resulting unsigned
    > integer type is reduced modulo the number that is one greater than the
    > largest value that can be represented by the resulting type.

commit ecfcc51b38a6457708e5b54dadc5065b48365ad8
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 19 23:21:43 2016 +0900

    Add usage messages for usage() and usage_advanced()
    
    All messages are copied from md5sum.c in GNU coreutils.

commit 3d68a13673a604f06154bd52709cb826917176ad
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 19 23:10:23 2016 +0900

    Add auto cleaning for test-xxhsum-c
    
    Follow @Cyan4973's suggestion:
    https://github.com/Cyan4973/xxHash/pull/53#issuecomment-174521226

commit ef40492536e952828726ca7a0fc8d229d5106734
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Jan 25 19:25:46 2016 +0900

    Add test target "test-xxhsum-c" and "clean-xxhsum-c"
    
     - "test-xxhsum-c" tests xxhsum -c functions.
        - Input from file, pipe, stdin.
        - Basic warning/error cases
            - XXH32/64 mixed format warning.
            - Hash mismatch error.
            - Failed open or read error.
     - "clean-xxhsum-c" removes temporary files for testing.
    
    There are potential problematic implementation:
    
     - Dot prefix for file name: ".test.xxh32" and ".test.xxh64"
        - I use dot prefix to simplify glob specifier ('*' ignores dot files).
        - Perhaps they make confusion for users.
    
     - "$?" shell variable and test(1)
        - Both variable and command are widely supported, but there is potential pitfall.
        - There are another possible solution,
            - "||", "&&" short circuit.
            - Shell's if..else command.
        - Linux bash(1) : http://linux.die.net/man/1/sh
        - FreeBSD sh : https://www.freebsd.org/cgi/man.cgi?query=sh&sektion=&n=1
        - MacOS bash(1) : https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Darwin/Reference/ManPages/man1/sh.1.html
        - Linux test(1) : http://linux.die.net/man/1/test
        - FreeBSD test(1) : https://www.freebsd.org/cgi/man.cgi?test
        - MacOS test(1) : https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Darwin/Reference/ManPages/man1/test.1.html

commit 9a648f76a8f52613d07842f144858b24d91a3397
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Jan 25 18:59:01 2016 +0900

    Fix stdin input for "xxhsum -c -"

commit 2783350952f0f2dce6de1e9a726a42669865d669
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Jan 22 15:06:25 2016 +0900

    Add redundant case for gcc -Wswitch-enum
    
     - gcc -Wswitch-enum warns them.  But this is completely false-positive.
    
    xxhsum.c:956:13: warning: enumeration value ‘GetLine_ok’ not handled in switch [-Wswitch-enum]
                 switch (getLineResult)
                 ^

commit 779a60563ed7597cfba19284f4119405df46e442
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Jan 22 15:02:46 2016 +0900

    Remove unused value

commit c93b51c22eb562b18f5843ccd9bef27c017799ce
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Jan 22 14:53:32 2016 +0900

    Implement variable length line reader.
    
     - Basic logic is same as GNU coreutil's lib/getline.c and lib/getdelim.c
     - Since this implementation fully depends on fgetc(), there is possible performance problem.

commit 2cfc7a2d6a8faf35194a735c623ead286038645d
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Jan 22 14:37:27 2016 +0900

    Fix wrong format specifier (%ul -> %lu)

commit 5c8aab6e6ad9787c4bfd7557237e4a5c4bc95089
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Jan 22 13:22:35 2016 +0900

    Fix line number related definitions
    
     - To keep code simple, now line number is "unsigned long" instead of "size_t".
     - We use "%ul" to print unsigned long.

commit 80897236f9243bb3e1c429977e6d85c0214cb8e9
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Jan 22 13:19:19 2016 +0900

    Fix return value
    
     - Return value must be 0 for error.

commit f47e8e1ff84855b6fea8916f1f5f27d6c46c80a2
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Jan 20 23:45:52 2016 +0900

    Add file check mode "-c" and related switches.
    
     - Add the following command line switches
        - "-c"/"--check" : read XXH32/64 sums from FILEs and check them.
        - "--quiet" : Don't print OK.
        - "--status" : Don't output anything to stdout/stderr.
        - "--strict" : Treat any invalid line as error.
        - "--warn" : Show warning message for invalid line.
     - If all checksum procedure is succeeded, exit code is 0.
        - Otherwise exit code is 1.
    
    All avobe functions basic logics are inherited from md5sum.

commit 1090f766c29fff2334a4e01c956240ef8f0f36da
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Jan 20 23:06:35 2016 +0900

    Split hash generation function for reusing
    
     - Add hash generation function BMK_hashStream() which generates hash value from file stream.
     - First argument void* is not violate strict aliasing, but dedicated union may be good for readability.

commit 36c19812632a0fdb0c56c2f4d5a9d1567d0d142d
Author: Takayuki MATSUOKA <takayuki.matsuoka@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Jan 20 22:18:53 2016 +0900

    Add default hash seed symbols

commit 438baab7167c1608649a50d2f4136fa0d26933de

Date:   Thu Oct 30 09:59:42 2014 +0100

commit 962c515f879a5eed23841fffa1d9a80913c34722
Merge: ccd8a42 f85bfd7
Author: Cyan4973 <yann.collet.73@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 13 03:18:17 2014 +0200

    Merge pull request #4 from sfgagnon/patch-1
    
    Memory allocation validation

commit f85bfd7f8d58acbfe8e85f0563df302db1c6da90
Author: Stephane Gagnon <sfgagnon@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Mon Aug 11 23:29:19 2014 -0400

    Memory allocation validation
    
    malloc is used to allocate the state structure, but XXHxx_resetState() uses the allocated buffer without checking if allocation was successful.
    User can then check for NULL pointer to validate that XXHxx_init was successful without a core dump.
    
    thank you.

commit 99a867a14adda6a233f6d8bfb93a735010b88268
Author: yann.collet.73@gmail.com <yann.collet.73@gmail.com@a90a0800-428d-89a3-ac20-94765a7798ee>
Date:   Thu Jul 25 08:40:23 2013 +0000

    Runtime endianess detection
    removed typecast warnings for 64-bits CPU with aligned-only memory accesses
    made bench.c compatible with tcc
    small bench.c optimisation, reducing impact of timer calls
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://xxhash.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@31 a90a0800-428d-89a3-ac20-94765a7798ee

commit 681ea2aad6367279f8b82149de8657e9b17be8d6
Author: yann.collet.73@gmail.com <yann.collet.73@gmail.com@a90a0800-428d-89a3-ac20-94765a7798ee>
Date:   Tue Jun 4 12:01:50 2013 +0000

    Support non-aligned input on strict-align CPU systems, as requested by Gregory Pakosz
    Type XXH32_stateSpace_t, for static allocation ( typically for stack allocation, or freestanding systems). Suggested by Christoph Cullmann and Takayuki Matsuoka
    User definable memory-related functions (malloc, free, memcpy)
    Changed enum OK into XXH_OK
    Restricted intrinsic _rotl to MSVC, due to poor performance under minGW
    
    git-svn-id: https://xxhash.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@30 a90a0800-428d-89a3-ac20-94765a7798ee

commit 107fd8f2a60611afd641aa4b53521ac042e533ec

    Added : Makefile, for GCC
    Modified Basic Types and C99 detection.
